channel.title: Blog
channel.description: Resources and news in the areas of world history, genocide and teaching.

item.title: Cambodian Genocide: Definitions
item.description: The Cambodian Genocide has a number of terms that may be unfamiliar to someone new to its study. I’ve put together a starter reference page here: Definitions of the Cambodian Genocide.

item.title: Democide in the USSR: Terms Defined
item.description: The terms list I’ve put together here deals mainly with the Great Purge and the Ukrainian famine under Stalin. It is a starting point for your studies: Definitions of Democide in the USSR.

item.title: War: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: War is a wide-ranging topic with terms you will see in many other histories. This is a reference page to help you through your readings and lectures: Definitions of War.

item.title: Holocaust Reference
item.description: The scope of Holocaust study is so far-reaching that reference sheets can be really useful. I have put together two pages to help: Definitions of the Holocaust and People in the Holocaust.

item.title: Updates on Armenian Genocide Information
item.description:
The Armenian Genocide is the first topic that I am editing and refining with expert help. The Director of Education for the Genocide Education Project, Sara Cohan, has helped me to eliminate less useful sources and directed me towards better ones on each of these pages. I am grateful to her for generously sharing her expertise.

Armenian Genocide - I have altered the description slightly to be more clear.

Definitions of Armenian Genocide - I have replaced about half the wikipedia definitions with definitions from academic sources more focused on the Armenian Genocide.

Links Regarding the Armenian Genocide - I have eliminated more politically-bent sites and added some new ones.

Films Dealing with the Armenian Genocide - I moved the Armenian language films to the bottom and deleted politically-bent films.

Bibliography of the Armenian Genocide - I have added several new books recommended by the Genocide Education Project.

item.title: 1971 Atrocities in Bangladesh: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description:
Here are some terms to start learning about the massacres in Bangladesh. Please know that I am starting each definitions page with wikipedia, so that I can group relevant terms in one place, but I will return to it and exchange those definitions for better ones as I find them.
Definitions of Genocide in Bangladesh

item.title: Genocide in Darfur: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description:
The current genocide in Darfur requires some background knowledge to be able to follow many of the more rigorous articles about it. Please start learning here, and then find a group where you can take action.
Definitions of Genocide in Darfur

item.title: Indonesian Massacres of 1965-66: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: The Indonesian Massacres were a brutal event in the Cold War. I have put key terms here: Definitions of the Indonesian Massacres.

item.title: Genocide of the Herero & Nama: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: This genocide is often referred to as the first modern genocide, and is often linked to later atrocities by the Nazis through medical training and ideology. I have put a list of terms for reference here: Definitions of the Genocide of the Herero & Nama.

item.title: Enemies of the People: A New Film
item.description: The second is a new film online for a few weeks about Cambodia. It was suggested to me by Sara Cohan, Director of Education at the Genocide Education Project. http://www.pbs.org/pov/enemies/. I posted the description on my Cambodian Films page, added at the bottom.
